children.name: to teach sb a skill or how to do sth
teach
children.definition: dạy học
examples: I’ve always wanted to learn to ski - could you teach me?
teach sth to sb
It took us several hours to teach all the dance moves to the girls
teach sb sth
Grandpa taught me a new card trick.
teach sb (how) to do sth
Who taught you to drive?
My mother taught me how to cook.

children.name: train
children.definition: to teach sb thepracticalskillsand knowledge that they need to do ajob:huấn luyện, đào tạo
examples: A lot of employers don’t train their staff properly.
train sb to do sth
All employees will be trained to use the new computer system.
The dog was trained to detect illegal drugs.
train sb in sth
We train people in skills such as typing and business administration.
trained[usually attri adj] được đào tạo
The service is run by trained nurses.
fully trained
All the staff are fully trained and willing to help in any way they cam

children.name: coach
children.definition: to teach a person or a team the skills they need for a sport: huấn luyện viên
examples: He seems to enjoy coaching children.
We need someone to coach the school team.
As well as teaching French, Martin coached tennis in his spare time.

children.name: instruct
children.definition: to teach sb about sth, especially a practical subject or skill, by explaining it and showing them what to do: huấn luyện, hướng dẫn
examples: The person who instructed you obviously didn’t know much about map-reading!
instruct sb in sth
New recruits are instructed in marching and the handling of weapons.

children.name: show sb the ropes
children.definition: informal to show sb how to do sth such as a job that they are new to: chỉ ai đó làm gì
examples: You’ll need someone with you for the first few days to show you the ropes.
Susan will show you the ropes and answer any questions that you have.

children.name: designed or intended to teach sth
educational
children.definition: educational books, games, television programmes etc are designed to help you to learn something:có tính giáo dục
examples: a shop selling educational toys for 7- to 11-year-olds
a leading publisher of educational books and software

children.name: instructive
children.definition: providing a lot of useful information, explanations, and knowledge about sth:có tính hướng dẫn
examples: Lectures must be interesting as well as instructive.
The books are designed to be both entertaining and instructive.

children.name: learning
children.definition: use this about books, methods, activities etc that are intended to teach people sth:học hỏi, học tập
examples: They stock a wide variety of learning materials for younger students.
How can we make the most of the Internet as a learning tool?

children.name: to teach in a school, college etc as your job
teach
children.definition: to teach in a school, college etc as your job: dạy học
examples: I taught for a year in France.
She got a job teaching German at a local school.
I prefer teaching the older children.
Miss Himes teaches the youngest class, the four- and five-year-olds.
teach sth to sb
She teaches English to Italian students.
Teaching literature to the fifth grade is no joke!
teach sb sth
You must remember Mr Hughes - he used to teach us history.
teach schoolAmerican to teach in a school dạy học
My Dad taught school in New York.

children.name: lecture
children.definition: to teach in a university or college:giảng dạy
examples: Before his retirement he lectured at the Institut Pasteur.
lecture on
She lectures on Shakespeare at Edinburgh University.
lecture in
For many years Dr Thornton lectured in Economics at University College.

children.name: give
children.definition: if sb gives a class, lecture, or course, they teach it:dạy học, dạy dộ
examples: Dr Hebden will be giving a lecture later this week on the role of women in the economy.
Who’s giving the class this afternoon?

children.name: to teach people how to think or behave
teach
children.definition: to teach sb, especially a child or young person, how to behave or what to believe: dạy dỗ, dạy bảo
examples: teach sb to do sth
When I was young, children were taught to treat older people with respect.
teach sb (that)
Joe’s mother taught him that he could do anything, if only he tried hard enough.
teach sb sth
Parents need to teach their children the difference between right and wrong.

children.name: educate
children.definition: to teach people, especially over a long period of time, about things that will be helpful to them in life: giáo dục
examples: We need to educate people so that they understand the importance of a good, healthy diet.
educate sb about sth
Youngsters must be educated about the dangers of drugs.
educate b to do sth
What we’re trying to do is to educate young people to be responsible citizens.

children.name: bring up
children.definition: to teach your child or children how to behave or think as they grow up:dạy dỗ, nuôi nâng
examples: bring sb up to do sth
I was brought up to spend money carefully and save as much as I could.
Stan had been brought up to believe that a man should work to support his wife.
bring sb up in the belief/conviction/knowledge
Alison was brought up in the belief that she was in some way superior to other children.

children.name: instil
children.definition: UK /instillUS  formal to teach sb a way of thinking or behaving, especially relating to morals, good manners, over a long period of time: làm cho thấm nhuần
examples: We aim to teach the children discipline and instil a sense of duty.
instil sth in/into sb
We have tried to instil good manners in our children from an early age.
She instilled tremendous enthusiasm into all her students.
It is part of a teacher's job to instilconfidencein/into his or her students.

children.name: brainwash
children.definition: to teach sb to believe sth by continuously repeating it over a long period of time, especially when they are tired, weak, or confused, so that they accept it without questioning it: tẩy não
examples: Mrs Davis accused the cult of having brainwashed her daughter.
brainwash sb into doing sthtẩy não ai đó để họ làm gì
For years we’ve been brainwashed by advertising into buying more and more things that we don’t need.
brainwashing[U]
Brainwashing techniques include preventing the person from sleeping and depriving them of any human contact.

children.name: condition
children.definition: /kənˈdɪʃən/  to make someone think or react in a particular way by influencing their attitudes or reactions over a long period of time: được dạy quen với
examples: condition somebody to do something ai đó được dạy quen với việc gì
▪ He was conditioned to obey his father at all times.
condition somebody into doing something dạy dỗ ai đó quen với việc gì
▪ The people have been conditioned into thinking that anyone from outside their community represents a threat to them.
conditioning[uncountable noun] được dạy dỗ, tập quen
▪ It can take years of therapy to undo early childhood conditioning.
conditionverb[ T ]
to train or influence a person or animal mentally so that they do or expect a particular thing without thinking about it
_a conditioned reflex/response
_[ + to infinitive ]Pavlov conditioned dogstosalivate at the sound of a bell.
_Women were conditionedtoexpect lower wages than men.

children.name: indoctrinate
children.definition: to teach sb to accept a particular set of religious or political beliefs, without allowing them to discuss it, doubt it, or consider other possible beliefs: truyền bá, nhồi nhét
examples: Some politically active teachers were accused of trying to indoctrinate their students.
indoctrinate sb into doing sth
Citizens were indoctrinated into believing that their leader was the source of all wisdom and goodness.
indoctrination[U]
She believes that all religious teaching in schools is indoctrination.

children.name: teach sb a lesson
children.definition: teachsba lesson( day cho ai mot bai hoc)
examples: A person or experience that teaches you a lesson improves your future behaviour by making you experience the bad effects of your actions
_Having my car stolen really taught me a lesson - I'll never leave it unlocked again.
_She decided to teach the boy a lesson.

children.name: teaching
children.definition: the work that a teacher does, or the job of being a teacher: dạy học
examples: Andrea took some time off from teaching when her children were small.
go into teachingbecome a teacher
What made you go into teaching?
leave teachingngừng dạy
He left teaching and took a job as a truck driver.

children.name: training
children.definition: when sb is taught the skills that they need for a job: đào tạo, huấn luyện
examples: have trainingđược huấn luyện
Have you had any medical training?
New staffhave/receivea week's traininginhow to use the computers.
give sb training
All new staff should be given computer training.
training course
We all had to go on a special training course to learn new sales techniques.

children.name: education
children.definition: the work of teaching people in schools, colleges, universities etc: giáo dục, dạy học
examples: The new policies have been welcomed by people working in education.
Jobs in education are not usually highly paid.
the Labour Party’s spokeswoman on education

children.name: instruction
children.definition: teaching in a particular skill or subject: chỉ dẫn, hướng dẫn
examples: Young drivers come to us for instruction in safe and skilful driving.
Half an hour’s instruction from an experienced horse-rider is much better than anything you can learn from a book.
under instructionbeing taughtđược dạy, được hướng dẫn
The trainees work at their machines under instruction from a supervisor.

children.name: tuition
children.definition: teaching given privately to one person or a small group in a particular subject: dạy thêm, dạy gia sư
examples: Nina’s parents paid for extra tuition to help her with her maths.
Computerworld offers personal tuition on the latest equipment.
All students receive tuitioninlogic and metaphysics.
tuitionfees

children.name: coaching
children.definition: a process in which you teach a person or team the skills they need for a sport: huấn luyện
examples: tennis/football/rugby etc coaching
acoaching sessionwith one of England’s leading boxers

children.name: orientation
children.definition: training or preparation for a new job or activity :sự định hướng(nghề nghiệp, học hành)
examples: The department has arranged an orientation session.
This is orientation week for all the new students.

children.name: hand sth down
children.definition: handsthdown to pass traditions from older people to younger ones : truyền lại
examples: a custom handed down through the generations

children.name: discipline
children.definition: nounTRAINING kỷ luậtorsự thi hành kỷ luật
examples: [ U ] training which producesobedience(= willingness to obey) or self-control, often in the form of rules, and punishments if these are broken,ortheobedienceor self-control produced by this training
_parental/military/school discipline
_There should be better discipline in schools.
_I don't have enough (self) discipline to save money.
